perturbation.original_text:
PAYMENT TERMS All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL. No. Name Function Amount

1. Ms. Chen Weijie Coordinator/Lead Developer USD100,000.00

2. Mr. Zheng Qing Developer USD50,000.00

3. Mr. Gu Xianwin Developer USD50,000.00
perturbation.changed_text:
PAYMENT TERMS All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment to the following individual below within a reasonable time upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL. No. Name Function Amount

1. Ms. Chen Weijie Coordinator/Lead Developer USD100,000.00

2. Mr. Zheng Qing Developer USD50,000.00

3. Mr. Gu Xianwin Developer USD50,000.00
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'within 7 days' to 'within a reasonable time,' the contract creates ambiguity regarding the payment deadline. While specific amounts are still listed, the lack of a concrete timeframe introduces uncertainty and could lead to disputes. This contradicts the intent of having fixed payment terms for the services.

perturbation.original_text: INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND OWNERSHIP All Intellectual Property during the project is owned by VAL, and will be turned over to VAL at the conclusion of the project by Developer and after the fulfillment of all commercial obligations by the VAL. All rights and title to Duesey Coffee Intellectual Property created pursuant to the Project shall belong to VAL and shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND OWNERSHIP All Intellectual Property during the project is owned by VAL. All rights and title to Duesey Coffee Intellectual Property created pursuant to the Project shall belong to VAL and shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase, 'and will be turned over to VAL at the conclusion of the project by Developer and after the fulfillment of all commercial obligations by the VAL', we create a contradiction because the contract states the IP is owned by VAL during the project but does not explicitly state the terms of ownership after completion. This omission introduces uncertainty about when and under what conditions the IP rights are fully transferred, or if they are at all.

perturbation.original_text: TERMINATION VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by giving two (2) weeks' notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by giving two (2) weeks' notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed. In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work done till date to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text: TERMINATION VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by giving two (2) weeks' notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by giving two (2) weeks' notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed. In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work done till date to VAL.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase, 'up to the date of termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis', the contract no longer defines how VAL shall compensate the Developer. This absence of the compensation conditions creates a contradiction because the document states the developer shall be compensated, but fails to define how much or the conditions required for it to occur.
